tool.name: metfragcli
tool.command: java -jar /usr/local/bin/MetFragCLI.jar PeakListPath=$infile MetFragDatabaseType=$MetFragDatabaseType IonizedPrecursorMass=$IonizedPrecursorMass DatabaseSearchRelativeMassDeviation=$DatabaseSearchRelativeMassDeviation FragmentPeakMatchAbsoluteMassDeviation=$FragmentPeakMatchAbsoluteMassDeviation FragmentPeakMatchRelativeMassDeviation=$FragmentPeakMatchRelativeMassDeviation PrecursorIonMode=$PrecursorIonMode IsPositiveIonMode=$IsPositiveIonMode MetFragScoreTypes=FragmenterScore MetFragScoreWeights=$MetFragScoreWeights MetFragCandidateWriter=CSV SampleName=Galaxy ResultsPath=/tmp MaximumTreeDepth=$MaximumTreeDepth MetFragPreProcessingCandidateFilter=UnconnectedCompoundFilter; if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then cat /tmp/Galaxy.csv > $outfile; else exit 1; fi;

param.name: infile
param.label: Input file with peak list in tsv/txt format

param.name: MetFragDatabaseType
param.label: Database
param.help: Database to which queries are sent. At the moment, only PubChem is supported.

param.name: IonizedPrecursorMass
param.label: Mass Index
param.help: Enter ionized precursor mass, neutral mass or mass of sum formula here.

param.name: DatabaseSearchRelativeMassDeviation
param.label: Relative mass deviation of database search
param.help: Relative mass deviation used for database search.

param.name: FragmentPeakMatchAbsoluteMassDeviation
param.label: Fragment peak match absolute mass deviation
param.help: Absolute mass deviation for fragment peaks to be matched.

param.name: FragmentPeakMatchRelativeMassDeviation
param.label: Fragment peak match relative mass deviation
param.help: Relative mass deviation for fragment peaks to be matched.

param.name: IsPositiveIonMode
param.label: Ion Mode
param.help: Ion mode that was used (either positive or negative).

param.name: MetFragScoreWeights
param.label: MetFrag Score Weights
param.help: Weight used for scoring in MetFrag.

tool.help: MetFrag: In silico fragmentation for computer assisted identification of metabolite mass spectra.
